transcript:
gave orders that no one should leave his post. Now you, Captain," and he turned to a thin, dirty little artillery of- ficer who without his boots (he had given them to the canteen keeper to dry), in only his stock- ings, rose when they entered, smiling not alto- gether comfortably. 
"Well, aren't you ashamed of yourself, Cap- tain Tusliin?" he continued. "One would think that as an artillery officer you would set a good example, yet here you are without your boots! The alarm will be
